title: super-elipse serif face with nice uppercase N
content:
I have a hard time finding the name of this one:

[http://home.planet.nl/~dadyo/ploaties/vdv3.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111215229/http:/home.planet.nl/~dadyo/ploaties/vdv3.gif)

The only ones I found so far that have a simmilar N are Beguiat, Elysim and Korrina and a few sans-serif ones.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [vdv3.gif](http://web.archive.org/system/files?file=vdv3.gif) | 4.15 KB |
author: dadyo

comments.content:
‘ [Priori](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111215229/http:/www.emigre.com/EF.php?fid=197)’, _by [Jonathan Barnbrook](http://web.archive.org/wiki/Jonathan%20Barnbrook)_, _features a smiliar ‘N’_, _as well_..  
_( But, No match yet.. )_

Dav, [formlos](http://web.archive.org/web/20051111215229/http:/www.formlos.net/)

I found out (by watching it this morning) that the TV-series Frasier has a simmilar font in the black inbetween screens. I have no image of it and I have seen the character N only so short that I was not able to determine if it was the font I was looking for. Before my TV-network put on the commercials at the end of the show I have seen a glimps of the credits and that looked the same, but slightly more ‘ellegant’ than the one I need…  
All help is still welcome.
I believe Frasier uses Korinna for its credits and intertitles.

So the Frasier (Korinna) font does not match. Still no luck for me… (thanks anyhow)

No-Matches so far: Benguiat, Elysium, Korinna and Priori.

If someone knows a font that has everything matching except for the N than I settle for that (and rebuild the N myself…)
